generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Rebalancing. Undersampling Method
generalDescription.objective: Balance the class distribution for changing the data space when applying usual classifiers in imbalanced domains
generalDescription.howWork: This algorithm finds a subset S of the training set T applying the Class Purity Maximization clustering procedure.

parameterSpec.param: Number of neighbors: Integer value. Number of nearest instances considered to generate a new positive example using the K-Nearest Neighbor Rule

Type of SMOTE: both if we consider as neighbors instances from both classes, minority if we consider as neighbors instances from the minority class and ASMO if we consider as neighbors instances from the majority class
Balancing: YES, if we want de data class distribution completely balanced, NO otherwise
Quantity of generated examples: if the Balancing option is not selected, proportion of examples from the majority class that the minority class has to reach

Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
Type of Interpolation: way of interpolating the neighbors instances to create a synthetic instance. Standard is the original interpolation proposed.
Alpha: alpha parameter for the BLX-alpha interpolation
Mu: mu parameter for the SBX interpolation
